placeDesc: A holdover from Holland’s past, the Nieuwe Spiegelstraat in Amsterdam is lined with arcane antique shops, each one a museum to an obscure corner of history.Particularly worth visiting is Thom & Lenny Nelis Antiques (541 Keizersgracht; 31-20-623-1546) which holds a collection of medical instruments, dissection kits, dental tools, apothecary jars and “a dinosaur-sized plaster tooth that once hung over a dental office.”Also worth seeing is Staetshuys Antiquairs (Nieuwe Spiegelstraat 45a, +31(0)20 6200300) where you can find globes, sextants, telescopes, planetariums, telluriums, and other nautical and scientific instruments of all kinds.
placeShortDesc: An Amsterdam street lined with antique shops each one dedicated to a different obscure collection.
placeNearby: Hans Brinker Budget Hotel,Pijpencabinet (Amsterdam Pipe Museum),KattenKabinet
placeRelatedLists: 12 Places in Europe That Will Inspire Wanderlust
placeRelatedPlaces: Kunstkammer Georg Laue,Ospedale delle Bambole (Doll Hospital),The Evolution Store,Bolivia's Witch Market
